isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS GUIDES - ENGINE TEST NOMENCLATURE - DEFINITION OF A/R NUMBER

svcproc.title: DEFINITION OF A/R NUMBER
svcproc.para:
The A/R number is Area ''A'' (Figure 3.4)
divided by ''R'' - the distance from the center of the turbine wheel to the centroid of Area ''A'' - which will determine the flow of the gas for a given turbine wheel. If ''A'' is increased, the turbine wheel will slow down. If ''A'' is decreased, the turbine wheel will increase in speed and boost pressure will increase giving false readings and premature turbocharger failure can be expected. The specified A/R turbine housing must not be changed to ensure maximun engine life and performance.
